file.name: 3.1 GET Operation (answers).yaml
file.path: OSSNA-OpenAPI-Workshop-2018/OASv3/workspace1/3 - GET Operation and Responses/answers/3.1 GET Operation (answers).yaml
file.content:
# OpenAPI v3 Training Exercise openapi: "3.0.0" info: version: 1.0.0 title: TaxBlaster API description: | # Answers: GET Operation This OpenAPI 2.0 document has `/taxpayers` and `/taxpayers/{id}` path items, each with an OPTIONS operation. In this exercise, we'll create GET operations and specify responses on these resources. 1. On the `/taxpayers` path item, add a GET operation as follows: * Description is "Retrieve the entire list of taxpayers." * Specify an individual HTTP 200 (OK) response. * Response description should be "OK" * The schema for the response should be:
`$ref: "#/definitions/Taxpayers"` (plural)

2. On the `/taxpayers` GET method you added in step 1, add a response for HTTP 400 (Bad Request) with the schema `"#/definitions/ErrorResponse"`, and description "The request may have included an unrecognized or unsupported parameter." 3. On the `/taxpayers` GET method, add a default response for all unspecified responses from the server with the schema `"#/definitions/ErrorResponse"`, and description "Unexpected error in processing the request." 4. On the `/taxpayers/{id}` path item, add a GET operation: * Description is "Retrieve an individual taxpayer." * Specify an individual HTTP 200 (OK) response. * Response description should be "OK" * The schema for the response should be:
`$ref: "#/definitions/Taxpayer"` (singular)

5. On the `/taxpayers/{id}` GET method you added in step 4, add a response for HTTP 404 (Not Found) with the schema `"#/definitions/ErrorResponse"`, and description "A taxpayer with the specified ID could not be found." 6. On the `/taxpayers/{id}` GET method, add a default response similar to step 3. paths: /taxpayers: options: description: Request information about methods available responses: '200': description: OK get: description: Retrieve the entire list of taxpayers. responses: '200': description: OK content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/Taxpayers" '400': description: > The request may have included an unrecognized or unsupported parameter. content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse" default: description: > Unexpected error in processing the request. content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse" /taxpayers/{id}: parameters: - description: ID of the individual taxpayer. name: id required: true in: path schema: type: string options: description: Request information about methods available responses: '200': description: OK get: description: Retrieve an individual taxpayer. responses: '200': description: OK content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/Taxpayer" 400: description: > A taxpayer with the specified ID could not be found. content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse" default: description: > Unexpected error in processing the request. content: application/json: schema: $ref: "#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse" components: schemas: TaxFiling: type: object required: - filingID properties: filingID: type: string taxpayerID: type: string jurisdiction: type: string fileDate: type: string format: date isJointFiling: type: boolean TaxFilings: type: array items: $ref: "#/components/schemas/TaxFiling" Taxpayer: type: object required: - taxpayerID properties: taxpayerID: type: string firstName: type: string lastName: type: string maritalStatus: type: boolean Taxpayers: type: array items: $ref: "#/components/schemas/Taxpayer" ErrorResponse: description: An error string returned from a bad response. type: object properties: errorMessage: type: string stackTrace: type: string
